Description: Fragment of upper wall and rim of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior: glazed black with single reserved band; exterior: myrtle wreath around rim with reserved band below; red-figure decoration consisting of two figures to right (of first, face with added white fillet and one outstreched arm; of second, only back of veiled(?) head with white fillet and cloaked shoulder).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1120)
